###  Rozzelle Court Restaurant is currently open.

Lunch: 11 am-2 pm   
Coffee and dessert: 2-4 pm   
Sips & Snacks, Thursday and Friday nights from 5 to 8 p.m. in Bloch Lobby _Assorted small plates, beer, wine and mixed drinks_   
  
[Rozzelle Court Restaurant](https://nelson-atkins.org/visit/things-to-do/rozzelle-court/) is on level one of the Atkins Building near Kirkwood Hall.

accessibility_text:
[Home](https://nelson-atkins.org/)[Visit](https://nelson-atkins.org/visit/)Accessibility

## Accessibility

We strive to make the Nelson-Atkins accessible and welcoming to every guest.

  * Wheelchair accessibility
  * Accommodations
  * Tours and programs
  * Upcoming events
  * Programs by request
  * What to expect

### Wheelchair accessibility

Most public areas in the Nelson-Atkins are wheelchair accessible. View the museum map for wheelchair accessibility guidance.

PARKING GARAGE

Garage parking is free for guests with ADA placards. The parking garage (located at 45th Street & Oak Street) is fully ADA accessible.*

 **BLOCH LOBBY**

The Bloch Building’s lobby can be directly accessed from the parking garage and is fully ADA accessible.

**ROZZELLE COURT RESTAURANT**

The restaurant is partially accessible. Using ramps, guests with wheelchairs can access and dine on the lower and upper levels.

**donald j. hall** **sculpture park**

The Sculpture Park has limited accessibility, with brick-paved paths, inclines, and stairs that may not accommodate mobility devices and strollers.

**RESTrooms**

All restrooms have wheelchair-accessible stalls, including automatic-door restrooms in Ford Learning Center.

**elevators**

Accessible elevators are located throughout the museum.

_*The center and south parking aisles of the parking garage have a height allowance of 9’6”; all other areas have an allowance of 7’._

### Accommodations and services

### About Bloch Building enhancements

Throughout 2026, the beloved Bloch Building will undergo state-of-the-art improvements. Read more about the project and stay up-to-date on temporary gallery closures.
